description: The uptime dashboard displays data about the hosts, high availability vms and all vms uptime and downtime.

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays uptime and downtime data for the hosts, high availability virtual machines and all virtual machines in the selected cluster.

panels.description: The average unplanned downtime per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            samples.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        samples.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            samples.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date, host_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    name AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date, host_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- BR14A - This query returns the

-- and total time per cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours,

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.vm_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0

            (
